issue.title: Overlapping Text
issue.body:
### Bug Description

When i join a server the various stages of connection to a server (Connecting to server, Encrypting etc.) overlap with the cancel button. This however only happens when the GUI scale is at 2: when it's at 1 it shifts the text under the cancel button instead.
![2023-10-19_14 27 05](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/assets/126591243/243d9c68-3eb2-4aa0-9edd-928d99504af1)


### Reproduction Steps

1: Set GUI scale to 2

2: Join a server


### Log File

[latest.log](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13058247/latest.log)


### Crash Report

[crash-2023-10-20_22.10.52-client.txt](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13058254/crash-2023-10-20_22.10.52-client.txt)

issue.title: Sodium 0.5.3 - Execution protection violation
issue.body:
### Bug Description

I am experiencing a crash when starting Minecraft 1.20.2 with Fabric 0.14.24 and Sodium 0.5.3. I am using the Prism Launcher (having read the list of known issues), although I experienced the same crash when using MultiMC. My graphics card is an NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti and I have updated my graphics driver today (version 545.92). I am using Windows 10 and Java 17 from Eclipse Adoptium. Other system specifications can be provided if they would be helpful. It seems relevant to mention that I am only able to set the maximum memory allocation in Prism Launcher up to 1536 MiB, otherwise the Java test fails.

### Reproduction Steps

1. Install and open Prism Launcher
2. Create a new instance with the settings and mods described above
3. Launch the instance

### Log File

[latest.log](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13179341/latest.log)


### Crash Report

My "crash-reports" folder has not been generated yet. I do have a crash report which was in the root ".minecraft" folder, which I believe contains a lot of the same information: [hs_err_pid2312.log](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13179378/hs_err_pid2312.log)

comment.body: Aha! All working properly now - obviously still an issue but not for me. Thanks for the help.

issue.title: Create Compat w/ Sodium
issue.body:
### Bug Description

When loading the game with Create and Sodium, Create tells me I need version 0.5.0 or up of Sodium, and I have version 0.5.3, yet it crashes before loading the game

Install Create and Sodium newest fabric/quilt versions. Create = 0.5.1-d-build.1161+mc1.20.1, Sodium = 0.5.3

issue.title: Add Apple Silicon specific optimisations for macOS
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
It's not optimised enough for Apple Silicon Macs

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add Apple Silicon specific optimisations for macOS and also some in-general optimisations for Macs
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
No alternatives

**Additional context**
No additional context

comment.body:
> Member

Actually it is. Sodium and Minecraft are using outdated Legacy Tools.
So its actually not Apples fault for not supporting dead tools.
Not supporting Metal is totally fine since of the low user base.
But not supporting Vulkan which is the official replacement of OpenGL is kinda Legacy

issue.title: Zink
issue.body:
### Request Description

Implementing Zink would be awesome.
The Game would run on Vulkan without Code rewrite. (I already see that native Vulkan isnt very popular with Devs here)
Especially on macOS, where the latest OpenGL version is 3.Something
It would be an awesome boost combined with OpenGL.
But other platforms would also benefit from it.
So this is the perfect solution and make all shader features compatible with different plattforms

comment.body:
Zink+MoltenVK would still increase the Framerate drastically then using the Legacy old OpenGL.
Even on non macOS Device Zink would still overcome OpenGL since OpenGL is not really optimized with modern hardware

issue.title: Sodium stops function of custom potions
issue.body:
### Bug Description

I'm a person that likes custom items. Today, I made a test potion after adding Sodium 0.5.2, and surprise, it didn't work. I then went on vanilla Minecraft, and it worked just fine. Heres the command I used if you need it: /give @p splash_potion{custom_potion_effects:[{id:glowing,duration:72000,amplifier:1}]} 1

### Reproduction Steps

It's really quite simple. Just play Minecraft with Sodium added. Then, go the GamerGeeks website. Find the bar on the left side and select "Potions/Arrows". Choose any effect you want, and enter in the duration (in ticks) and the level or amplifier (amplifier 0 is 1, 1 is 2, so on.) Copy the command, and run it in chat. The description of the potion should be "No Effects".

### Log File

[latest.log](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13096564/latest.log)


### Crash Report

[crash-2023-10-23_21.25.48-client.txt](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13098116/crash-2023-10-23_21.25.48-client.txt)
Note: This bug obviously didn't crash my game.

issue.body:
### Bug Description

I'm a person that likes custom items. Today, I made a test potion after adding Sodium 0.5.2, and surprise, it didn't work. I then went on vanilla Minecraft, and it worked just fine. Heres the command I used if you need it: /give @p splash_potion{custom_potion_effects:[{id:glowing,duration:72000,amplifier:1}]} 1

### Reproduction Steps

It's really quite simple. Just play Minecraft with Sodium added. Then, go the GamerGeeks website. Find the bar on the left side and select "Potions/Arrows". Choose any effect you want, and enter in the duration (in ticks) and the level or amplifier (amplifier 0 is 1, 1 is 2, so on.) Copy the command, and run it in chat. The description of the potion should be "No Effects".

### Log File

[latest.log](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13096564/latest.log)


### Crash Report

[crash-2023-10-23_21.25.48-client.txt](https://github.com/CaffeineMC/sodium-fabric/files/13098116/crash-2023-10-23_21.25.48-client.txt)
Note: This bug obviously didn't crash my game.

comment.body: I cannot reproduce this with Sodium 0.5.3. The command you provided created a potion with the description "Glowing II". The glowing effect works as intended and looks identical to the effect in vanilla.

issue.title: Zink
issue.body:
### Request Description

Implementing Zink would be awesome.
The Game would run on Vulkan without Code rewrite. (I already see that native Vulkan isnt very popular with Devs here)
Especially on macOS, where the latest OpenGL version is 3.Something
It would be an awesome boost combined with OpenGL.
But other platforms would also benefit from it.
So this is the perfect solution and make all shader features compatible with different plattforms
